extendedIngredients.name: brussels sprouts
extendedIngredients.original: 3 cups trimmed halved Brussels sprouts (about 1 1/2 pounds)

title: Brussels Sprouts with Crisp Prosciutto
summary: Brussels Sprouts with Crisp Prosciutto is a gluten free and primal side dish. This recipe makes 6 servings with 96 calories, 5g of protein, and 5g of fat each. For $1.03 per serving, this recipe covers 16% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe from My Recipes has 1 fans. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes. Head to the store and pick up salt, brussels sprouts, butter, and a few other things to make it today. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 55%. This score is solid. Try Brussels Sprouts With Prosciutto And Pecans, Brussels Sprouts With Prosciutto and Walnuts, and Brussels Sprouts With Frizzled Prosciutto for similar recipes.
instructions: Cook Brussels sprouts in boiling water 3 minutes or until crisp-tender; drain.                                                                                                Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat; add prosciutto. Cook 6 minutes or until crisp, stirring occasionally. Remove from pan; set aside.                                                                                                Heat pan coated with cooking spray over medium-high heat. Add Brussels sprouts; saut 3 minutes or until lightly browned. Add butter, salt, and pepper, stirring until butter melts. Remove from heat; drizzle with juice. Add prosciutto; toss to combine.                                                                                                Note: Pull off any limp outer leaves, and closely trim the stem end-don't cut too much off, or the Brussels sprouts may fall apart.

steps.step: Cook Brussels sprouts in boiling water 3 minutes or until crisp-tender; drain.
Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat; add prosciutto. Cook 6 minutes or until crisp, stirring occasionally.
Heat pan coated with cooking spray over medium-high heat.
Add Brussels sprouts; saut 3 minutes or until lightly browned.
Add butter, salt, and pepper, stirring until butter melts.
Remove from heat; drizzle with juice.
Note: Pull off any limp outer leaves, and closely trim the stem end-don't cut too much off, or the Brussels sprouts may fall apart.
